commit.message:
Fix ATLAS tightcache find test (#3560)

This test keeps failing with Input/Output errors as the repository grows.
It is likely that this is just the increased size of pinned catalogs that do not fit anymore in the purposefully small cache, but it should be debugged with a recent root hash. For now, use an older root hash that is known to work in this test to fix the test suite.

verification.payload:
tree 0fd4f4e76645433520286a88fd064329fb6a74e7
parent 6b4ccc1203164d8ff39b11f0e6443194fc541b89
author Valentin Volkl <valentin.volkl@cern.ch> 1712174330 +0200
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1712174330 +0200

Fix ATLAS tightcache find test (#3560)

This test keeps failing with Input/Output errors as the repository grows.
It is likely that this is just the increased size of pinned catalogs that do not fit anymore in the purposefully small cache, but it should be debugged with a recent root hash. For now, use an older root hash that is known to work in this test to fix the test suite.

commit.message:
Fix some printf related warnings (for fedora38 build) (#3530)

This commit silences two warnings, that need to be fixed since rpmbuild treats them as errors, starting with Fedora 38.

The first is:
``
cvmfs/cvmfs/util/exception.cc: In function ‘void Panic(const char*, LogSource, int, const char*, ...)’:
cvmfs/cvmfs/util/logging.h:28:51: warning: format not a string literal and no format arguments [-Wformat-security]
   28 |     ((void)0) : LogCvmfs(source, mask, __VA_ARGS__));  // NOLINT
      |                                                   ^
cvmfs/cvmfs/util/exception.cc:47:3: note: in expansion of macro ‘LogCvmfs’
   47 |   LogCvmfs(source, mask, msg);
      |   ^~~~~~~~
```
where I add a "%s" format to fix it.

The second is -Wformat-zero-length, due to the use of
```
LogCvmfs(kLogCvmfs, kLogStdout, "");
```
to print a newline. The workaround is to replace these with
```
LogCvmfs(kLogCvmfs, kLogStdout | kLogNoLinebreak, "\n");
```

verification.payload:
tree 6871d889981862f79d423a513139d5b6ba224b2b
parent 8a778a58aba195a50745ab4058ef7799644b2116
author Valentin Volkl <valentin.volkl@cern.ch> 1710407368 +0100
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1710407368 +0100

cvmfs/cvmfs/util/logging.h:28:51: warning: format not a string literal and no format arguments [-Wformat-security]
   28 |     ((void)0) : LogCvmfs(source, mask, __VA_ARGS__));  // NOLINT
      |                                                   ^
cvmfs/cvmfs/util/exception.cc:47:3: note: in expansion of macro ‘LogCvmfs’
   47 |   LogCvmfs(source, mask, msg);
      |   ^~~~~~~~
```
where I add a "%s" format to fix it.

The second is -Wformat-zero-length, due to the use of
```

```
to print a newline. The workaround is to replace these with
```

```

commit.message:
shrinkwrap: skip named pipes without aborting sync of containing dirs (#3522)

When shrinkwrapping a spec like
```
/gentoo/*

```
which includes the named pipe `/gentoo/2023/x86-64-v3/var/spool/nullmailer` (real world example from soft.computecanada.ca), shrinkwrap would log the following:

```
(libcvmfs) Encountered unknown file type '4096' for source file /gentoo/2023/x86-64-v3/var/spool/nullmailer/trigger
(libcvmfs) File /gentoo/2023/x86-64-v3/var/spool/nullmailer failed to copy
```
and stop processing the wildcard at this point, leaving the shrinkwrapped  `/gentoo` incomplete. This commit adds a case for this file type and just skips them, avoiding the incomplete copy.

The named pipe could actually be recreated in the shrinkrap destination, but I would assume most applications just recreate it themselves.

Also cleans up a typo in a shrinkwrap comment.

verification.payload:
tree ce547ec9fdf63a105daaf4cb523b1fa3f5cc34a4
parent 85ecc6947340a1e14cdfa29779c07e4c73572a2a
author Valentin Volkl <valentin.volkl@cern.ch> 1709203159 +0100
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1709203159 +0100

shrinkwrap: skip named pipes without aborting sync of containing dirs (#3522)

When shrinkwrapping a spec like
```
/gentoo/*

```
which includes the named pipe `/gentoo/2023/x86-64-v3/var/spool/nullmailer` (real world example from soft.computecanada.ca), shrinkwrap would log the following:

```
(libcvmfs) Encountered unknown file type '4096' for source file /gentoo/2023/x86-64-v3/var/spool/nullmailer/trigger
(libcvmfs) File /gentoo/2023/x86-64-v3/var/spool/nullmailer failed to copy
```
and stop processing the wildcard at this point, leaving the shrinkwrapped  `/gentoo` incomplete. This commit adds a case for this file type and just skips them, avoiding the incomplete copy.

The named pipe could actually be recreated in the shrinkrap destination, but I would assume most applications just recreate it themselves.

Also cleans up a typo in a shrinkwrap comment.

commit.message: update changelog

[gw] add regression test for lease db locking (#3510)

* [gw] add regression test for lease db locking

This test reproduces the issue of lease end requests failing with

```
Lease end request - error reply: {"reason":"delete statement failed: database is locked","status":"error"}
```

as reported originally by LHCb (#3259).

The problem has been fixed in #3258 by liberally applying mutexes, but at the cost of performance regressions in other API operations, as reported by Matt (#3460). This patch supplements a regression test in order to be able to amend the original fix.

The test here handcrafts the API requests to the gateway instead of using transactions, which would work too, in order to avoid the overhead of running multiple publishers. It fairly consistently reproduces the error when testing a non-fixed gateway ( I tried to find a compromise between runtime and constency here. Sleeping between requests seems to had little effect)  and runs successfully with the fix.

Since it only gets and cancel leases, the test may not be exhaustive, but it's a start.

* slightly longer loop for better consistency

* whitespace

* whitespace

verification.payload:
tree cd165b4a0c3cf2d1993ea7b79b3a2f5d6a6972ec
parent 5a94219dcb9ed8d9478f3f048589e5a95d85dfd4
author Valentin Volkl <valentin.volkl@cern.ch> 1708608483 +0100
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1708608483 +0100

[gw] add regression test for lease db locking (#3510)

* [gw] add regression test for lease db locking

This test reproduces the issue of lease end requests failing with

```
Lease end request - error reply: {"reason":"delete statement failed: database is locked","status":"error"}
```

as reported originally by LHCb (#3259).

The problem has been fixed in #3258 by liberally applying mutexes, but at the cost of performance regressions in other API operations, as reported by Matt (#3460). This patch supplements a regression test in order to be able to amend the original fix.

The test here handcrafts the API requests to the gateway instead of using transactions, which would work too, in order to avoid the overhead of running multiple publishers. It fairly consistently reproduces the error when testing a non-fixed gateway ( I tried to find a compromise between runtime and constency here. Sleeping between requests seems to had little effect)  and runs successfully with the fix.

Since it only gets and cancel leases, the test may not be exhaustive, but it's a start.

* slightly longer loop for better consistency

* whitespace

* whitespace

commit.message:
[cleanup] fix syntax highlighting in test scripts (#3508)

This is a purely decorative change, in the sense that it should have no effect on any functionality, but fixes syntax highlighting. Since the integration test scripts have no .sh suffix, most editors will display them as text files, in particular also the github web page renders them in this not-very-readable way (VSCode manages to infer that it's a script).

Adding a #!/bin/bash throughout seemed the easiest way of fixing this - it maybe slightly confusing because none of these scripts are executed (all of them are sourced and then cvmfs_run_test() is run by another script), but it provides enough of a hint to editors to make them more readable.

I also take the opportunity to harmonize file permissions on the main scripts - a few of them had +x set, I've removed this for all of them.

verification.payload:
tree a399fffcd0c48f879f8bfb98d7333e951dbe58b4
parent 46e1b326b777ce50befb72400709e82e938de6db
author Valentin Volkl <valentin.volkl@cern.ch> 1707769752 +0100
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1707769752 +0100

[cleanup] fix syntax highlighting in test scripts (#3508)

This is a purely decorative change, in the sense that it should have no effect on any functionality, but fixes syntax highlighting. Since the integration test scripts have no .sh suffix, most editors will display them as text files, in particular also the github web page renders them in this not-very-readable way (VSCode manages to infer that it's a script).

Adding a #!/bin/bash throughout seemed the easiest way of fixing this - it maybe slightly confusing because none of these scripts are executed (all of them are sourced and then cvmfs_run_test() is run by another script), but it provides enough of a hint to editors to make them more readable.

I also take the opportunity to harmonize file permissions on the main scripts - a few of them had +x set, I've removed this for all of them.
